Text.Value: 'When the night is dark, stars shine brightest.' So keep on shining. It's going to be all right.
Just be careful out there, all right? I can't handle anyone else dying.
I don't feel lucky. I feel... I feel like I'm at the end of my rope.

EditorData.NodeContext: Lost. Grieving. Looking for guidance, for reassurance.

Text.Value: I knew it. The moment you came through that door I just knew.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Closing eyes, grief-stricken. Every word a loss.
EditorData.NodeContext: Closing eyes. Deep breathe. Mourful and heartbroken.

Text.Value: Which one was Asharak again?
It's a sad day to be giving this, but here.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to be grateful but still sounding a bit sad

Text.Value: Honestly? Sheer dumb luck.
When I'm sure it's safe, I'll see about rounding people up to follow the light.
They lined us up like dogs. Asharak was with the kids, telling them it was gonna be all right.
That means a lot, coming from you. You always seem to take everything in your stride.

EditorData.NodeContext: warmth but little bit of grief at the end

Text.Value: Why would you say something like that? What is wrong with you? Actually - never mind.
I'm so sorry.
I am! Sorry - that came out wrong. Thank you - I know you did everything you could.

EditorData.NodeContext: embarrassed - trying to find the right words

Text.Value: Then I'm glad we were lucky enough to meet you.
Leave.
But thank you - I'm sure you did what you could.
Stop whining.
Danger is my life - there is no greater thrill for me than the hunt.
Some of us fought back - or tried to. But it was hopeless.

EditorData.NodeContext: Thinking back on how terrified you were

Text.Value: Maybe that's why they picked him. Told him to kneel...
We're in the same boat, then? That's... somewhat of a comfort.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sad smile but trying to end on a nice note

Text.Value: I'm sure they're fine. Probably being held for questioning.
You don't know? Stars above...
How did you survive?
You think a few shadows could beat me?
Everyone else might welcome you with open arms, but stay the hells away from me you lute-smashing arsehole.
Danger is my life - I wouldn't change it for the world.
I believe in ballads they call that 'talent' and 'courage'.
How did you do it? How did you get them out of that hellspit?
He said he stayed in the grove because of you, and I'm damn glad of it. Without him... well, none of us would be here.
Gods alive! Why?!
Wandering into the darkness was a stupid idea.
My teacher always said emotions are to be felt - not feared.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sad smile at the mention of your beloved teacher

Text.Value: I'm glad you made it too, it's one hell of a curse.
Can you blame him? His brother and sister are gone. He's... dealing with it as best he can. We all are.

EditorData.NodeContext: worried for rolan. She's not chiding the player, merely trying to explain

Text.Value: 'Heart's Requiem', right? The hero survives a war and rebuilds her life - stronger than ever. A tale worth remembering - especially now.

EditorData.NodeContext: Small laugh. a touch of delight among the grief

Text.Value: You make it sound so easy - but I'll try.
If it was anyone else, I'd be sceptical - but you? You've more than earned the title of hero.
I take what I'm due and I don't look back.
Damn it, no! Once we left that bloody grove, everything was supposed to be all right! We were supposed to be safe.
Maybe. Sorry, I shouldn't have said anything. You've enough on your plate.
Don't say that. When I think of what would have happened if Cal and Lia weren't there...

EditorData.NodeContext: worried for rolan, cal and lia

Text.Value: It's not much, but you here - deserve it.
Only the strong survive. You want to live? Focus on yourself.
...Never mind, then. Just - just leave me be.
Stars, you hadn't heard?
Thank you. If anyone can manage it, you can.
Our group grows smaller and smaller. We've lost many, but we have you to thank for the ones who survived.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to be grateful but still sounding a bit sad

Text.Value: Honestly? Sheer dumb luck.
You can trust me.
The others should be in Baldur's Gate: safe, happy. To die like they did... they didn't deserve it.

EditorData.NodeContext: Upset. Just barely holding it together.

Text.Value: Which...? He was on the quiet side, but had a heart of gold. Back in the grove, he'd kept an eye on the kids. Gods, that feels like a lifetime ago.
They lined us up like dogs. Ikaron was with the kids, telling them it was gonna be all right.
I'll let you know when I figure it out.
First cultists nearly murder us, and now we have a traitor on the inside? Can't we trust anyone?

EditorData.NodeContext: frustrated and tired of being scared

Text.Value: Just leave me be.
It wasn't the curse that did us in.

EditorData.NodeContext: Smile dropping. Horror entering her voice

Text.Value: Cal and Lia were dragged away, along with the others. Rolan isn't... taking it so well. None of us, to be honest.
They were good people - they deserved to die old and happy. Not in the hands of monsters.

EditorData.NodeContext: Upset but trying to be sincere and grateful at the end

Text.Value: Cultists? What happened?
If he hadn't listened to me, maybe his brother and sister would still be here.
Rolan? The apprentice wizard?
I keep replaying it... over and over in my head.

EditorData.NodeContext: horrified - remembering how scared she was

Text.Value: It was that or get dragged to Moonrise.
...Wait. No one's told you?
And I regret it with every breath.
This anger you feel? This fear? Use it. Don't give in to it.
And your damn well good at it. Thank you - for everything.
I imagine the cultists are torturing them right now.
By the time we get to the city, I'm gonna have an entire catalogue of songs about you.
I'll do everything in my power to save them - you have my most solemn vow.
I heard what happened - that people were taken to Moonrise.
By doing what I do best - being a hero.
Running was the right call.
It just... it just never stops.
I had to watch my friends, people who can barely hold a sword, try to fight a pack of murderous zealots.

EditorData.NodeContext: Thinking back on how terrified you were

Text.Value: Only fools fight an ambush. Better to live and strike another day - preferably to the neck.

EditorData.logicalname: Alias (Not Met / Received quest from others)

Text.Value: You're all right! Thank goodness, I was worried they'd got you too.

EditorData.NodeContext: Relieved. Trying to be cheerful but you're upset, and just holding it together.
EditorData.logicalname: Not Met / Received quest from others

Text.Value: Don't worry, I'll find them.
Leave.
You've done so much for us already, but I have to ask - the others might still be out there.
I've seen a lot of nasty ambushes in my time - but that sounds among the worst. I'm sorry.
You're back! Is... is everything all right?
Honestly? Terribly.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to put on a brave face but you are NOT all right.

Text.Value: If they're not dead, they're in Moonrise. And gods have mercy on anyone in that hellspit.
That Flaming Fist seemed kind. I keep looking at everyone and wonder whose side they're really on...
You ran? Cowardly.
You're lucky to be alive.
The other tieflings are dead.
They lined us up like dogs. Someone told them to rot in the Nine Hells, that we weren't going anywhere.
...If you say so. But not everyone is as strong as you are.
I know - Rolan isn't happy with me.
You should be grateful I managed to save anyone at all.
We were ambushed out in the darkness - by cultists. We surrendered, but that wasn't enough for them.
Watch yourself out there. Please.
I know what I am and what I'm not - and I'm not ashamed of running. No matter what you think.
What did the cultists do to the others?
I see some familiar faces, but where's everyone else?
You're made of sterner stuff than me then.

EditorData.NodeContext: Sad smile but trying to end on a nice note

Text.Value: I know - you've been there for us every step of the way. It's just all a bit much sometimes, you know?
I don't complain constantly. It's very annoying.
Which...? Back in the grove, he ran drills with the kids. Wooden swords and the like. That seems like a lifetime ago now.
You're right. We can't give in - not now. Thank you.
I'm sorry it came to that. But if it was you or them, I'd pick you every time.
That sounds quite freeing - but I don't have that option, I'm afraid.
Of course I am. As if there was any doubt.
Go away.

EditorData.NodeContext: Mad at player, they either upset you or were kind of an ass to you

Text.Value: Yes. He shielded me and the kids while his brother and sister rushed the cultists.

EditorData.NodeContext: Still horrified but also admiring what cal, lia and rolan did.

Text.Value: You're truly unpleasant sometimes, you know? Don't know why I bother.

EditorData.NodeContext: More sad and disappointed than offended

Text.Value: All I could do was run.

EditorData.NodeContext: Thinking back on how terrified you were

Text.Value: It helps to remember what is at stake - I fight for nature, for balance. I fight for life itself.
With all this darkness, I'd forgotten what light, true blazing light, felt like. Thank you - we needed a bit of hope.
They took his eyes first. Then his tongue.
Just focus on getting through this.
Easier said than done.

EditorData.NodeContext: frustrated sigh but trying to rally herself

Text.Value: I don't know. It just... happened so quickly.
How about you? How are you holding up?
I'm sorry, but the others? They didn't make it.
You actually did it - you rescued them from Moonrise. How?
Rolan, of all people, saved us.
I'm afraid doubt is all I know these days.

EditorData.NodeContext: Trying to put on a brave face but you are NOT all right.

Text.Value: Killing everyone who got in my way.
How do you do it? How do you keep going?

EditorData.NodeContext: Lost. Looking for guidance, for reassurance.

Text.Value: By doing what I do best - being a hero.
I still can't believe it. The cultists. The screams...

EditorData.NodeContext: Hurt. Thinking back on how terrified she was

Text.Value: To linger in the past is to condemn our future. Focus on the here and now.
A strong weapon-arm and a bit of luck. That's all you need.
I'm glad it was you who walked through that door. Thank you.
I cannot help - I have far greater evils to conquer. But your friends have survived worse - I am sure they will be fine.
Just take it one step at a time.
Which one was Ikaron again?

Synopsis: Alfira has seen her friends, people she considered family, dragged screaming into the nigh. She is upset and only just holding it together. She asks the player to save the prisoners in Moonrise.
